channel.title: contracting on Brandontreb
channel.description: Recent content in contracting on Brandontreb

item.title: Software Development Consulting: Some Tips On Structuring Your Contracts
item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com
item.description: When I first started out as an independent software developer, one of things that stressed me out the most was how to structure contracts that I sent to clients. Working for a consultancy in my previous work-life I had seen contracts before, however, I never really paid enough attention to them to know what type of content went into them. After quite a bit of research, I found an invaluable resource.

item.title: Being An Indie Software Developer And Signing NDAs
item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com
item.description: Very frequently, I receive emails that go something like this: “Hey Brandon, I have a killer project idea. Do you want to work on it? Please sign the NDA so we can talk.” Early on when I first started consulting, I would have responded with something like “Sure send it over!” and signed the thing without hesitation. As of late, I have changed my view on NDAs; at least in this type of situation.

item.title: What I Learned In My First Year Of iOS Consulting
item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com
item.description: Wow, I can’t believe it has already been a full year since I struck it out on my own. Last year, I published a post after my first month on doing contract iOS development. Needless to say, I have grown and learned quite a bit over the past year and I wanted to share some of those experiences. Income While I won’t share exact numbers, I left my 6 figure/year job to pursue the indie/consulting life.

item.title: The Top 5 Places To Find Good Software Developers/Contractors
item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com
item.description: One thing I am often asked is “Where can I find good developers/contractors/subcontractors?” While I have found talent many different ways, I wanted to share my top 5 with you. This post should be useful to you if you have a project and are looking to find a developer OR are a developer looking to subcontract some of your work. I am sharing these based solely on my experiences with them and hope you find value in this list.
